intro: Morinda brachycalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx morinda, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture. Morinda brachycalyx is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
